chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Smith

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Cases called: 22FO325, 22FO326, 22FO425, 22TR2446, 22TR2447, 22CM364 & 22CM770. Defendant Jesse J. Smith in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1: Operate with a Restricted Controlled Substance and Count 1 in 22CM770: Misd Bail Jumping. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders:
on 22CM770: court costs and surcharges and DNA sample
on 22CM364: $811.50, 6 months driver's license revocation, AODA. Defendant completed an AODA as part of the agreement. 

Anything else including all of the ride along citations are dismissed and read in.

10:03 AM cases 22CM770, 22CM364 called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesse J. Smith in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant states the offer requires him to complete AODA assessment, which is scheduled for later this week.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Judge Jon Theisen for Branch 2 Intake. 10:06 am case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J. Smith in court without counsel.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J. Smith in court without counsel. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/29/22 at 2:30pm
Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:34 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J. Smith in court without counsel. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/23/22 at 3:30 PM. 
Return to court: 6/16/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
